description.p: This wood and canvas glider transforms into a phoenix when thrown. It will travel 1d20+5 to the nearest 5 feat. Any creature in its path must make a Dexterity saving throw(DC: 10 + PB) or take 1d10+Con damage. Or half damage on a failed save. If the roll to throw is 1, the glider breaks on impact and must be repaired using 10GP of Canvas and wood.
While wearing these bracers, on your turn you may use a Bonus Action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your constitution modifier once per Short Rest.

When you cast a levelled spell, an ally within 30ft of you gains temporary hitpoints equal to the level of the spell cast. These temporary hitpoints stack with ones from this feature and last for 1 hour.
This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff.
This buckler is fashioned from a wood and bears the emblem of The Abbey of Silent Sorrows at its centre.
As a Bonus Action, when you make a two-handed weapon attack using your Action, you may make a weapon attack with the buckler dealing 1d8 + your strength modifier bludgeoning damage.

This staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: beast bond (1 charge), or crusader's mantle (3 charges). You can also use an action to cast the poison spray cantrip from the staff without using any charges.
The staff regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the staff makes a tremendous clattering noise, then vanishes forever.

set.addition: by a druid, or beastmaster ranger
